intro: Colymbada arachnoidea, commonly known as the spider orchid, is a rare and distinctive member of the orchid family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its unique, spider-like appearance, with long, thin stems and clustered, pale green to white flowers. It has specialized roots that form symbiotic relationships with mycorrhizal fungi, aiding in nutrient absorption. Due to its habitat specificity and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
